intro: Miconia farfanii, commonly known as the Farfan's miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions as a garden plant.
